snippet.textDisplay: @PaperMario15 sorry, no one consider that a failure in any sense, it is an epic game, SMB 1 and 2 (the original) share the same style and are both excellent games, so as zelda ocarina of time and majora's mask, metroid prime series and the list go on, nintendo knows when to stop and not making the thing repetitive (at least in the main series, of course those sports spin-offs are mostly the same thing)

snippet.textDisplay:
@DaManoMano

Super Mario RPG has the best story to it, besides the fact that it has RPG in the name and Square Enix (God-maker of RPGs) made it. I think having a story most of the time is good to help people keep on tract with the game without getting lost and confused. But at the same time, it's nice to have a game where you can just go out and just randomly veg with no cause behind it, like Dead Rising.
snippet.textOriginal:
@DaManoMano

Super Mario RPG has the best story to it, besides the fact that it has RPG in the name and Square Enix (God-maker of RPGs) made it. I think having a story most of the time is good to help people keep on tract with the game without getting lost and confused. But at the same time, it's nice to have a game where you can just go out and just randomly veg with no cause behind it, like Dead Rising.

snippet.textDisplay: Mario platformer with the best story? Super Paper Mario, since it's more of a platformer and less of an RPG.

snippet.textDisplay: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY let me ask you a question. what mario platformer do you think has the best story?
snippet.textOriginal: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY let me ask you a question. what mario platformer do you think has the best story?

snippet.textDisplay: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY i dunno, they could be motivated by the fact that the game is so damn fun, and they want to keep playing (kinda like a addiction). as for the mystery, its trying to guess what kind of zany idea theyll experience in the next level. like i said, the gameplay more than makes up for the story. yes, nintendo COULD add a elaborate story (as shown in the rpgs), but they deliberately chose not to, because they learned from SMG1 that story=bad in a mario platformer.
snippet.textOriginal: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY i dunno, they could be motivated by the fact that the game is so damn fun, and they want to keep playing (kinda like a addiction). as for the mystery, its trying to guess what kind of zany idea theyll experience in the next level. like i said, the gameplay more than makes up for the story. yes, nintendo COULD add a elaborate story (as shown in the rpgs), but they deliberately chose not to, because they learned from SMG1 that story=bad in a mario platformer.

snippet.textDisplay: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY its funny though, in SMGs case, the addition of story actually DID detract from the experience. read any SMG review, and theyll say that the rosalina diary thing, which is the only story-oriented part of the game, was the only bad thing about SMG, and thats why they gave a 9 or 9.5 instead of 10.

snippet.textDisplay: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY the story doesnt need to be elaborated on. its a plumber jumping on giant turtles in space. in fact, SMG2 is just so awesome that it more than makes up for lack of story. thats why i like nintendo the best. when sony is making giant blockbuster stories, completely putting gameplay as a second thought as shown in FFXIII and MGS4. nintendo does the opposite, making gameplay so awesome story desnt matter. graphics dont matter in a good ｐｌａｔｆｏｒｍｅｒ, so why should story?
snippet.textOriginal: @sihTdaeRtnaCuoY the story doesnt need to be elaborated on. its a plumber jumping on giant turtles in space. in fact, SMG2 is just so awesome that it more than makes up for lack of story. thats why i like nintendo the best. when sony is making giant blockbuster stories, completely putting gameplay as a second thought as shown in FFXIII and MGS4. nintendo does the opposite, making gameplay so awesome story desnt matter. graphics dont matter in a good ｐｌａｔｆｏｒｍｅｒ, so why should story?

snippet.textDisplay:
Honestly, it's a good thing Mario doesn't have a story.
Because with how much perfection he already has behind everything else he does, if Mario had a story then that'd be it. No one would buy any other game ever and it'd be a standard that Mario must be in a game for anyone to bother buying it.
I'm not even an avid Mario fan and I can recognize that he's that big!
snippet.textOriginal:
Honestly, it's a good thing Mario doesn't have a story.
Because with how much perfection he already has behind everything else he does, if Mario had a story then that'd be it. No one would buy any other game ever and it'd be a standard that Mario must be in a game for anyone to bother buying it.
I'm not even an avid Mario fan and I can recognize that he's that big!
